page.title: 08Chilsdown Vineyard
page.content: The vineyard is sighted between Singleton and West Dean,and is owned by Ian and Andrew Paget.They first started producing wine in 1974. On an average day during harvest time,1-4 tonnes of grapes are picked.The grapes are pressed in a large 'tombola',which traps the skins but leaves the juice, and sometimes the stalks. The vines do not require artificial food,as they grow well in the chalky soil of the area. The most expensive wine produced costs Â£3.80 per bottle,and the cheapest,'Grapple',is Â£2.70 per bottle. The vineyard has an average of 8000 visitors a year,and lies on the site of a Southern Railway station. The total area occupied by the vineyard is 13 acres (5.2 hectares.)
